description: Company policies, procedures, and internal resources

articles.title: Employee Onboarding Checklist
articles.content: New employees should complete the following steps within their first week: Sign employment contract and tax forms, attend orientation session, set up company email and accounts, meet with direct manager for role expectations, complete security training, and receive access badges. HR will coordinate these activities.
articles.author: HR Department

articles.title: Time Off Request Process
articles.content: Submit time off requests at least two weeks in advance through the HR portal. Requests require manager approval. Ensure adequate coverage is arranged before submitting. Unused vacation days roll over up to 5 days annually. Sick leave should be reported as soon as possible to your supervisor.
articles.author: HR Department

articles.title: Code Review Guidelines
articles.content: All code changes require peer review before merging. Reviewers should check for code quality, security vulnerabilities, test coverage, and adherence to style guides. Provide constructive feedback and approve only when all concerns are addressed. Average review turnaround should be within 24 hours.
articles.author: Engineering Lead

articles.title: Incident Response Protocol
articles.content: When a production incident occurs: Create incident channel in Slack, assign incident commander, notify stakeholders, begin investigation and mitigation, document timeline and actions taken, conduct post-mortem within 48 hours. Severity levels determine escalation procedures.
articles.author: DevOps Team

articles.title: Sales Discovery Call Framework
articles.content: Effective discovery calls follow the BANT framework: Budget, Authority, Need, Timeline. Start with rapport building, understand current challenges, identify pain points, qualify budget and decision-making process, and establish next steps. Document all findings in CRM immediately after the call.
articles.author: Sales Manager

articles.title: Customer Objection Handling
articles.content: Common objections and responses: Price concerns - emphasize ROI and total cost of ownership. Feature gaps - highlight roadmap and customization options. Competitor comparisons - focus on unique differentiators. Implementation time - showcase case studies with similar timelines. Always validate concerns before addressing.
articles.author: Sales Enablement

articles.title: Data Classification Guidelines
articles.content: Company data is classified into three levels: Public (no restrictions), Internal (employees only), Confidential (need-to-know basis). All confidential data must be encrypted. Customer data requires special handling per privacy policies. Label documents appropriately and follow storage guidelines for each classification level.
articles.author: Security Team

articles.title: Password and Authentication Policy
articles.content: Passwords must be at least 12 characters with mixed case, numbers, and symbols. Enable two-factor authentication on all company accounts. Never share passwords or store them in plain text. Change passwords every 90 days. Use company-approved password manager for secure storage.
articles.author: IT Security

articles.title: Remote Work Policy
articles.content: Employees may work remotely up to 3 days per week with manager approval. Maintain regular working hours and availability. Ensure secure internet connection and private workspace. Company equipment must be used for work activities. Attend required in-office meetings and team events as scheduled.
articles.author: HR Department

articles.title: Expense Reimbursement Process
articles.content: Submit expense reports within 30 days of purchase with itemized receipts. Approved categories include travel, meals with clients, professional development, and office supplies. Expenses over $500 require pre-approval. Reimbursements processed within 2 weeks of submission. Use company credit card when available.
articles.author: Finance Team

articles.title: Meeting Best Practices
articles.content: Every meeting should have a clear agenda distributed 24 hours in advance. Start and end on time. Assign a note-taker and action item owner. Limit attendees to essential participants. Record decisions and next steps. Follow up with meeting notes within 24 hours. Decline meetings without clear objectives.
articles.author: Operations

articles.title: Customer Escalation Procedure
articles.content: For customer issues requiring escalation: Document issue details and attempted resolutions, notify account manager immediately, loop in customer success manager, escalate to VP if unresolved within 24 hours. Maintain communication with customer throughout. Conduct resolution review after closure.
articles.author: Customer Success
